metadata.title: CVE-2022-3650 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A privilege escalation flaw was found in Ceph. Ceph-crash.service allows alocal attacker to escalate privileges to root in the form of a crash dump,and dump privileged information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3650` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
ceph-base - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
ceph-common - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
ceph-fuse - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
ceph-immutable-object-cache - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
ceph-mds - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
ceph-mgr - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
ceph-mgr-cephadm - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
ceph-mgr-dashboard - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
ceph-mgr-diskprediction-cloud - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
ceph-mgr-diskprediction-local - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
ceph-mgr-k8sevents - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
ceph-mgr-modules-core - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
ceph-mgr-rook - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3

cephadm - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
cephfs-shell - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
libcephfs-java - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
libcephfs-jni - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3

librados2 - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
libradosstriper1 - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
librbd1 - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
librgw2 - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
python3-ceph - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
python3-ceph-argparse - 15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3

No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '15.2.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.3').
